meanings.sent1: The blooming flowers filled the garden with color.
meanings.sent2: The blooming roses smelled lovely in the morning.
meanings.sent3: She wore a blooming flower crown to the party.
meanings.sent4: The blooming cherry blossoms painted the town pink.
meanings.sent5: The blooming daisies danced in the gentle breeze.

meanings.sent1: She was blooming happy to see her friend.
meanings.sent3: He ran blooming fast to catch the bus.
meanings.sent4: The music was blooming loud at the concert.
meanings.sent5: The sun shone blooming brightly in the sky.

meanings.definition: Used as a euphemism for a swear word.
meanings.sent1: She let out a blooming when she dropped her phone.
meanings.sent2: He muttered a blooming under his breath when he stubbed his toe.
meanings.sent3: The child innocently repeated the blooming she heard from her parents.
meanings.sent4: The comedian's joke was full of clever blooming.
meanings.sent5: The old sailor's favorite word was always blooming.
